intro: Scorzonera turcomanica, commonly known as the Turkmenian scorzonera, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and yellow flowers. The plant produces a tuberous root that is sometimes used in traditional medicine. Scorzonera turcomanica typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh climatic conditions. Its botanical features make it an important species in the study of plant resilience in dry regions.
